justification: It nods to Team B’s desire for consistency via a low-variance QB, but overlooks B’s core preference for workhorse RBs and injury caution. Ryan Taylor (workhorse, volatile) is B’s archetype; offering an injured, deep-threat WR mislabeled as a steady WR2 clashes with B’s possession/consistency bias. B already has a Tier 1 QB, so Nelson is a marginal upgrade. Little separation of A’s vs. B’s incentives. The rationale is sparse and partially inaccurate, making the proposal unlikely to appeal to B.
